item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Thursday, March 27, 2025 at 10:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ferrous Systems Donates Ferrocene Language Specification to Rust Project (72 points | 15 comments)
2. Servo vs Ladybird (41 points | 9 comments)
3. Google will now develop the Android OS in private (18 points | 6 comments)
4. What's New in Neovim 0.11 (58 points | 7 comments)

6. Introduction to Monoio: A High-Performance Rust Runtime (31 points | 11 comments)
7. Tunneling corporate firewalls for developers (5 points | no comments)
8. Good-bye core types; Hello Go as we know and love it (30 points | 3 comments)
9. You might want to stop running atop (90 points | 65 comments)
10. prepare()-ing for execution: a new API for process creation (2 points | no comments)
11. You should know this before choosing Next.js (19 points | 7 comments)
12. European Union creates Fedora-based Linux distribution for the public sector (6 points | 10 comments)
13. Oracle customers confirm data stolen in alleged cloud breach is valid (3 points | 2 comments)
14. RealtimeKit and CPU Scheduling (2 points | no comments)
15. You just can’t be Googling ‘Select’ (9 points | 19 comments)
16. Hyperlight Wasm: Fast, secure, and OS-free (10 points | no comments)
17. Revisiting CSS border-image (9 points | 2 comments)
18. Blasting Past Webp (11 points | no comments)
19. Don't bring slop to a slop fight (32 points | 15 comments)
20. Pi Pico Rx - A crystal radio for the digital age? (15 points | 1 comment)
21. A Very (!) Early Play With Astral's Red Knot Static Type Checker (6 points | no comments)
22. Commandments of reproducible builds (6 points | no comments)
23. War story: the hardest bug I ever debugged (1 points | no comments)
24. PEG parsing series (2019) (10 points | 1 comment)
25. Decent-Auth: backend auth library that works in several different languages via WASM (1 points | 1 comment)
